did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Records relating to the management of the journal. Includes administrative files, proofs and galleys, issues of Diacritics, submissions and reviews of articles. Also interviews with individuals involved in the publication.

bioghist.p: Diacritics is a forum for scholars writing on the problems of literary criticism, based in the Dept. of Romance Studies at Cornell University, published by The Johns Hopkins University Press. It was founded in 1971 under the editorship of David Grossvogel.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Records relating to the management of the journal. Includes administrative files, proofs and galleys, issues of Diacritics, submissions and reviews of articles. Also interviews with individuals involved in the publication.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: Cornell University. Department of Romance Studies.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Restriced to permission of the editor of Diacritics.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Diacritics Collection, #6988. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

arrangement.head: SERIES LIST
arrangement.p:
Series III. Submissions and Reviews
Boxes 6-14

Series IV. Issues of Diacritics
Boxes 15-16

scopecontent.p: Invitations to join and requests to resign from the Diacritics editorial board
internal correspondence pertaining to the Diacritics editorial board, often calls for meetings and descriptions of previous meetings.

internal correspondence from Diacritics editor Debra Castillo. Extensive and rich documentation of her (and assistant editor Kate Bloodgood's) attempts to reform the editorial processes of the Diacritics editorial board.
internal correspondence from Diacritics editor Richard Klein.
Correspondence between editor Joan Ramon Resina and other members of Diacritics editorial board and staff.
Notes from outgoing editor Philip Lewis to new editor Debra Castillo to facilitate transition.

did.unittitle: D. I. Grossvogel to unknown (Diacritics editor?) regarding metacriticism

scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Diacritics and Johns Hopkins University Press regarding marketing. Several documents regarding advertisement exchanges with other journals.
Correspondence between Diacritics and Johns Hopkins University Press regarding the journal's finances.
Administrative and other assorted correspondence between Johns Hopkins University Press and Diacritics.
Correspondence between editor Debra Castillo and outside scholars. Many solicitations for review articles, notably from Rodolphe Gasché and Anthony Appiah.
Correspondence between editor Bruno Bosteels and outside scholars.
Correspondence between editor Joan Ramon Resina and outside scholars.
Correspondence between editors Philip Lewis, Debra Castillo, Richard Klein, outside scholars, and staff and board members of Diacritics on proposals for review articles.
Correspondence between editor Joan Ramon Resina, outside scholars, and staff and board members of Diacritics on proposals for review articles.
Correspondence between editor Philip Lewis and outside scholars.
Correspondence between editor Philip Lewis and outside scholars, especially pertaining to revising submissions.
Correspondence between editor Jonathan Culler and outside scholars.
Proposals for review articles from outside scholars, often with extensive notes and/or back and forth correspondence with editor Debra Castillo and assistant editor Kate Bloodgood.
Various financial records from twenty years of the journal's history.
Details of tasks and hiring processes of editorial assistant.
Inquiries and responses to permissions requests
Legal documents pertaining to the founding of Diacritics. Also includes the minutes of the first Diacritics board meeting in 1971.
Inventories of articles published in Diacritics from 1987-2009.
Notes on style requirements for Diacritics submissions
Special issue: "Around the Work of Benedict Anderson"
Additionally contains some correspondence and examples of art used in the issue.
Earlier stage in editing process than other file of same name.
Earlier stage in editing process than other file of same name.
Special issue: "Essays in Memory of Pierre Klossowski"
Later in the design process than other file of same name.
Special issue "Literature and the Right to Marriage"
Special issue: "The Thought of Roberto Esposito"
Special issue: "Taking Exception to the Exception"
Proofs of Diacritics issue 25.1 featuring illustrations
Design notes for original format of Diacritics
Guidelines for proposals for Diacritics special issues.
Correspondence between Anthony Appiah and other intellectuals on possibility of a Diacritics issue devoted to African American thought and letters.
Proposal for special issue of Diacritics by Philip Lewis and Georges Van Den Abbeele devoted to Descartes.

did.unittitle: Special issue proposal: Philippe Lacoue-Labarthe and Jean-Luc Nancy

scopecontent.p: Proposal by Peter Fenves and Susan Berstein for a special issue of Diacritics issue devoted to the thought of Philippe Lacoue-Labarthe and Jean-Luc Nancy.

did.unittitle: Special issue proposal: Views of America

scopecontent.p: Proposal for special issue of Diacritics by Jose Piedra on America.

did.unittitle: Special issue proposal: Latin American Literature

scopecontent.p: Proposal for special issue of Diacritics by Debra Castillo devoted to Latin-American Literature. Ultimately published as Diacritics 25.1, "Latin/American Issues"

Internal and external correspondence planning the twenty-fifth anniversary issue of Diacritics, involving notes from board meetings, internal correspondence, and external solicitation of contributions.

Draft and notes from Richard Klein's "Nuclear Criticism," an article that appeared in Yale French Studies but that can be read as a corollary to the special issue of Diacritics of the same name, 14.2.
Proposal from Jonathan Monroe for special issue of Diacritics: "Poetry, Community, and Movement." Ultimately published as Diacritics 26.3-4.
Proposal from Nelly Furman for special issue of Diacritics devoted to Georges Bataille. Published as Diacritics 26.2
Proposal by Pheng Cheah and Elizabeth Grosz for special issue of Diacritics devoted to Luce Irigaray. Ultimately published as Diacritics 28.1.
Proposal for special issue of Diacritics by Jonathan Strauss on Death after the French Revolution. Ultimately published as Diacritics 30.3
Proposal for special issue of Diacritics by Biddy Martin and Richard Juang on transgender theory
Proposal for special issue of Diacritics by Jonathan Culler and Pheng Cheah on Benedict Anderson. Ultimately published as Diacritics 29.4.
Proposal for colloquium on Jacques Derrida's Glas, on its 25th anniversary.
Proposal by Simon Jarvis for a special issue of Diacritics devoted to rethinking beauty. Eventually published as Diacritics 32.1
Proposal by Steven Miller for a special issue of Diacritics devoted to Marriage. Eventually published as Diacritics 35.4.
Proposal by Simone Pinet and Oscar Martin for a special issue of Diacritics devoted to Medieval Iberia. Published as Diacritics 36.3-4

did.unittitle: Special issue proposal: Laruelle and Nonphilosophy

scopecontent.p: Proposal for a special issue of Diacritics devoted to François Laruelle and Nonphilosophy.
Proposal for a special issue by Namita Goswami of Diacritics devoted to Edward Said

did.unittitle: Special issue proposal: Biopolitics and Roberto Esposito

scopecontent.p: Proposal from Timothy Murray for special issue of Diacritics devoted to biopolitics and the thought of Roberto Esposito, which would ultimately appear as Diacritics 36.2.
Proposal from Bruno Bosteels for special issue of Diacritics devoted to Jacques Rancière and Politics.
Proposal from Jonathan Culler and Mark Seltzer for special issue of Diacritics devoted to science.

did.unittitle: Trevor Hope, "Sexual Indifference and the Homosexual Male Imaginary"
Elizabeth A. Povinelli, "Sexual Savages/Sexual Sovereignty: Australian Colonial Texts and the Postcolonial Politics of Nationalism"

Jacques Derrida, "Archive Fever: A Freudian Impression"

scopecontent.p: Highly significant piece by Jacques Derrida originally published in English in Diacritics 25.2. Presented here with correspondence regarding translation and the securing of rights.

scopecontent.p: Draft titled "Avoiding the Subject: Marjorie Perloff and the Neutralization of Theory" ultimately published in Diacritics 26.3-4.
Evaluation file on accepted article ultimately not published in Diacritics.

scopecontent.p: Papers by Jonathan Culler, Judith Butler, Lee Edelman, and Jane Gallop ultimately published in Diacritics 34.1

Bruno Chaouat, "In the Image of Auschwitz"

scopecontent.p: These papers are filed in mainly chronological order within the boxes.
Multiple submissions on Heidegger, Butler, Deleuze, Derrida, Said, etc.
Multiple submissions on Said, de Man, Irigaray, Derida, Žižek, Kant, Nancy, etc.
Multiple submissions on Derrida, Deleuze, Wittgenstein, Kant, etc.

did.unittitle: Interview with Philip Lewis with Laurent Ferri and Diane Brown
